title: Sundar Pichai To Nikki Haley, How Indian-Americans Reacted To Trump 2.0
content: Eminent Indian Americans on Wednesday welcomed the re-election of Donald Trump as the 47th president of the United States and assured to work with him on several issues, including that of the US-India relationship.
summary: Eminent Indian Americans on Wednesday welcomed the re-election of Donald Trump as the 47th president of the United States and assured to work with him on several issues, including that of the US-India relationship.

title: Kamala Harris Calls Trump To Congratulate Him On Election Win: Her Aide
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris called Donald Trump on Wednesday to congratulate him for winning the 2024 presidential election, one of her senior aides said, following a bitter and contentious race.

title: Florida, 2 Other States Defy Trend And Vote Down Abortion Rights
content: Voters approved most of the referendums expanding the right to abortion in US states while Florida, Nebraska and South Dakota rejected such measures, giving anti-abortion advocates victories since the Supreme Court ended the constitutional right.
summary: Voters approved most of the referendums expanding the right to abortion in US states while Florida, Nebraska and South Dakota rejected such measures, giving anti-abortion advocates victories since the Supreme Court ended the constitutional right.

title: Trump's Presidency Crushes Hopes Of First Female President, Again
content: The glass ceiling for women in politics just got even more daunting, as the prospect of a female US president has been shattered once again by Donald Trump.

title: Elon Musk's Tesla's Shares Soar Over 15% After Donald Trump's Big Win

title: Saudi King, Crown Prince Congratulate Donald Trump On Election Win: Report

title: "Immoral": Iran Minister Slams Woman Student's Public Act Of Stripping

title: Trump, Still Facing 2020 Capitol Riots Cases, Returns In 2024
content: Millions of Americans on Wednesday celebrated Donald Trump's remarkable return to the White House - the 78-year-old defied pre-poll predictions to become the first Republican in 20 years to win the popular vote en route to the presidency.
